CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. Polymers
2. Side-chain
3. D-A structure
4. E g (band gap)
5. Isotropic charge transport

These are the specific material entities mentioned in the paragraph, which can be identified as the names of materials or properties related to the material being discussed.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to "Material Name" in the given paragraph:

1. Polymers
2. D-A structure

These are the only entities in the paragraph that can be clearly identified as referring to a "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to "Material Name" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Polymers |
| D-A structure |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. Band gap (Eg) - a property of the resultant polymers that refers to the energy range of electrons that are able to move freely within the material.
2. Isotropic charge transport - a property of the polymers that refers to the ability of charges to move freely in all directions within the material, without any preference for a particular direction.
3. Side-chain D-A structure - a structural feature of the polymers that refers to the arrangement of the side chains (D) and the main chain (A) of the polymer molecule.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. Band gap (Eg) - a property of the resultant polymers that refers to the energy range of electrons that are able to move freely within the material.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Band gap (Eg) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. Band Gap (Eg): This is a property of the resultant polymers, which refers to the energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the polymer. The band gap is an important parameter in determining the electrical conductivity of a material.
2. Isotropic Charge Transport: This is another property of the resultant polymers, which refers to the ability of charges to move freely in all directions within the polymeric main chain. An isotropic charge transport means that the charge carrier mobility is the same in all directions, resulting in uniform electrical conductivity.

So, the two "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph are:

1. Band Gap (Eg)
2. Isotropic Charge Transport
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. Band Gap (Eg): This is a property of the resultant polymers, which refers to the energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the polymer. The band gap is an important parameter in determining the electrical conductivity of a material.

So, the only entity that refers to a value of a material property in the given paragraph is:

1. Band Gap (Eg)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Band Gap (Eg) |
